extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.elasticsearch.DeleteByQueryElasticsearch
extension.description: Delete from an Elasticsearch index using a query. The query can be loaded from a flowfile body or from the Query parameter.

property.name: el-rest-query
property.description: A query in JSON syntax, not Lucene syntax. Ex: {"query":{"match":{"somefield":"somevalue"}}}. If this parameter is not set, the query will be read from the flowfile content.

property.name: el-query-attribute
property.description: If set, the executed query will be set on each result flowfile in the specified attribute.

property.name: el-rest-fetch-index
property.description: The name of the index to use.

property.name: el-rest-type
property.description: The type of this document (used by Elasticsearch for indexing and searching).

property.name: el-rest-client-service
property.description: An Elasticsearch client service to use for running queries.

dynamicProperty.name: The name of a URL query parameter to add
dynamicProperty.value: The value of the URL query parameter
dynamicProperty.description: Adds the specified property name/value as a query parameter in the Elasticsearch URL used for processing. These parameters will override any matching parameters in the query request body

relationship.name: retry
relationship.description: All flowfiles that fail due to server/cluster availability go to this relationship.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: If the "by query" operation succeeds, and a flowfile was read, it will be sent to this relationship.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: If the "by query" operation fails, and a flowfile was read, it will be sent to this relationship.

writesAttribute.name: elasticsearch.delete.took
writesAttribute.description: The amount of time that it took to complete the delete operation in ms.

writesAttribute.name: elasticsearch.delete.error
writesAttribute.description: The error message provided by Elasticsearch if there is an error running the delete.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.elasticsearch.GetElasticsearch
extension.description: Elasticsearch get processor that uses the official Elastic REST client libraries to fetch a single document from Elasticsearch by _id. Note that the full body of the document will be read into memory before being written to a FlowFile for transfer.

property.name: get-es-id
property.description: The _id of the document to retrieve.

property.name: el-rest-fetch-index
property.description: The name of the index to use.

property.name: el-rest-type
property.description: The type of this document (used by Elasticsearch for indexing and searching).

property.name: get-es-destination
property.description: Indicates whether the retrieved document is written to the FlowFile content or a FlowFile attribute.

allowableValue.description: Output the retrieved document as the FlowFile content.
Output the retrieved document as a FlowFile attribute specified by the Attribute Name.

property.name: get-es-attribute-name
property.description: The name of the FlowFile attribute to use for the retrieved document output.

property.name: el-rest-client-service
property.description: An Elasticsearch client service to use for running queries.

dynamicProperty.name: The name of a URL query parameter to add
dynamicProperty.value: The value of the URL query parameter
dynamicProperty.description: Adds the specified property name/value as a query parameter in the Elasticsearch URL used for processing.

relationship.name: retry
relationship.description: All flowfiles that fail due to server/cluster availability go to this relationship.

relationship.name: document
relationship.description: Fetched documents are routed to this relationship.

relationship.name: not_found
relationship.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship if the specified document does not exist in the Elasticsearch cluster.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: All flowfiles that fail for reasons unrelated to server availability go to this relationship.

writesAttribute.name: filename
writesAttribute.description: The filename attribute is set to the document identifier

writesAttribute.name: elasticsearch.index
writesAttribute.description: The Elasticsearch index containing the document

writesAttribute.name: elasticsearch.type
writesAttribute.description: The Elasticsearch document type

writesAttribute.name: elasticsearch.get.error
writesAttribute.description: The error message provided by Elasticsearch if there is an error fetching the document.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.elasticsearch.JsonQueryElasticsearch
extension.description: A processor that allows the user to run a query (with aggregations) written with the Elasticsearch JSON DSL. It does not automatically paginate queries for the user. If an incoming relationship is added to this processor, it will use the flowfile's content for the query. Care should be taken on the size of the query because the entire response from Elasticsearch will be loaded into memory all at once and converted into the resulting flowfiles.

property.name: el-rest-query
property.description: A query in JSON syntax, not Lucene syntax. Ex: {"query":{"match":{"somefield":"somevalue"}}}. If this parameter is not set, the query will be read from the flowfile content.

property.name: el-query-attribute
property.description: If set, the executed query will be set on each result flowfile in the specified attribute.

property.name: el-rest-fetch-index
property.description: The name of the index to use.

property.name: el-rest-type
property.description: The type of this document (used by Elasticsearch for indexing and searching).

property.name: el-rest-client-service
property.description: An Elasticsearch client service to use for running queries.

property.name: el-rest-split-up-hits
property.description: Output a flowfile containing all hits or one flowfile for each individual hit.

property.name: el-rest-split-up-aggregations
property.description: Output a flowfile containing all aggregations or one flowfile for each individual aggregation.

property.name: el-rest-output-no-hits
property.description: Output a "hits" flowfile even if no hits found for query. If true, an empty "hits" flowfile will be output even if "aggregations" are output.

dynamicProperty.name: The name of a URL query parameter to add
dynamicProperty.value: The value of the URL query parameter
dynamicProperty.description: Adds the specified property name/value as a query parameter in the Elasticsearch URL used for processing. These parameters will override any matching parameters in the query request body

relationship.name: aggregations
relationship.description: Aggregations are routed to this relationship.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: All flowfiles that fail for reasons unrelated to server availability go to this relationship.

relationship.name: original
relationship.description: All original flowfiles that don't cause an error to occur go to this relationship.

relationship.name: hits
relationship.description: Search hits are routed to this relationship.

writesAttribute.name: mime.type
writesAttribute.description: application/json

writesAttribute.name: aggregation.name
writesAttribute.description: The name of the aggregation whose results are in the output flowfile

writesAttribute.name: aggregation.number
writesAttribute.description: The number of the aggregation whose results are in the output flowfile

writesAttribute.name: hit.count
writesAttribute.description: The number of hits that are in the output flowfile

writesAttribute.name: elasticsearch.query.error
writesAttribute.description: The error message provided by Elasticsearch if there is an error querying the index.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.elasticsearch.PaginatedJsonQueryElasticsearch
extension.description: A processor that allows the user to run a paginated query (with aggregations) written with the Elasticsearch JSON DSL. It will use the flowfile's content for the query unless the QUERY attribute is populated. Search After/Point in Time queries must include a valid "sort" field.

property.name: el-rest-query
property.description: A query in JSON syntax, not Lucene syntax. Ex: {"query":{"match":{"somefield":"somevalue"}}}. If this parameter is not set, the query will be read from the flowfile content.

property.name: el-query-attribute
property.description: If set, the executed query will be set on each result flowfile in the specified attribute.

property.name: el-rest-fetch-index
property.description: The name of the index to use.

property.name: el-rest-type
property.description: The type of this document (used by Elasticsearch for indexing and searching).

property.name: el-rest-client-service
property.description: An Elasticsearch client service to use for running queries.

property.name: el-rest-split-up-hits
property.description: Output a flowfile containing all hits or one flowfile for each individual hit or one flowfile containing all hits from all paged responses.

allowableValue.description: Combine results from all query responses (one flowfile per entire paginated result set of hits). Note that aggregations cannot be paged, they are generated across the entire result set and returned as part of the first page. Results are output with one JSON object per line (allowing hits to be combined from multiple pages without loading all results into memory).

property.name: el-rest-split-up-aggregations
property.description: Output a flowfile containing all aggregations or one flowfile for each individual aggregation.

property.name: el-rest-pagination-type
property.description: Pagination method to use. Not all types are available for all Elasticsearch versions, check the Elasticsearch docs to confirm which are applicable and recommended for your service.

allowableValue.description: Use Elasticsearch "search_after" to page sorted results.
Use Elasticsearch (7.10+ with XPack) "point in time" to page sorted results.

property.name: el-rest-pagination-keep-alive
property.description: Pagination "keep_alive" period. Period Elasticsearch will keep the scroll/pit cursor alive in between requests (this is not the time expected for all pages to be returned, but the maximum allowed time for requests between page retrievals).

property.name: el-rest-output-no-hits
property.description: Output a "hits" flowfile even if no hits found for query. If true, an empty "hits" flowfile will be output even if "aggregations" are output.

dynamicProperty.name: The name of a URL query parameter to add
dynamicProperty.value: The value of the URL query parameter
dynamicProperty.description: Adds the specified property name/value as a query parameter in the Elasticsearch URL used for processing. These parameters will override any matching parameters in the query request body

relationship.name: aggregations
relationship.description: Aggregations are routed to this relationship.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: All flowfiles that fail for reasons unrelated to server availability go to this relationship.

relationship.name: original
relationship.description: All original flowfiles that don't cause an error to occur go to this relationship.

relationship.name: hits
relationship.description: Search hits are routed to this relationship.

writesAttribute.name: mime.type
writesAttribute.description: application/json

writesAttribute.name: aggregation.name
writesAttribute.description: The name of the aggregation whose results are in the output flowfile

writesAttribute.name: aggregation.number
writesAttribute.description: The number of the aggregation whose results are in the output flowfile

writesAttribute.name: page.number
writesAttribute.description: The number of the page (request) in which the results were returned that are in the output flowfile

writesAttribute.name: hit.count
writesAttribute.description: The number of hits that are in the output flowfile

writesAttribute.name: elasticsearch.query.error
writesAttribute.description: The error message provided by Elasticsearch if there is an error querying the index.

systemResourceConsideration.description: Care should be taken on the size of each page because each response from Elasticsearch will be loaded into memory all at once and converted into the resulting flowfiles.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.elasticsearch.PutElasticsearchJson
extension.description: An Elasticsearch put processor that uses the official Elastic REST client libraries.

property.name: put-es-json-id-attr
property.description: The name of the FlowFile attribute containing the identifier for the document. If the Index Operation is "index", this property may be left empty or evaluate to an empty value, in which case the document's identifier will be auto-generated by Elasticsearch. For all other Index Operations, the attribute must evaluate to a non-empty value.

property.name: put-es-record-index-op
property.description: The type of the operation used to index (create, delete, index, update, upsert)

property.name: el-rest-fetch-index
property.description: The name of the index to use.

property.name: el-rest-type
property.description: The type of this document (used by Elasticsearch for indexing and searching).

property.name: put-es-record-batch-size
property.description: The preferred number of FlowFiles to send over in a single batch.

property.name: put-es-json-charset
property.description: Specifies the character set of the document data.

property.name: el-rest-client-service
property.description: An Elasticsearch client service to use for running queries.

property.name: put-es-record-log-error-responses
property.description: If this is enabled, errors will be logged to the NiFi logs at the error log level. Otherwise, they will only be logged if debug logging is enabled on NiFi as a whole. The purpose of this option is to give the user the ability to debug failed operations without having to turn on debug logging.

property.name: put-es-json-error-documents
property.description: If this configuration property is true, the response from Elasticsearch will be examined for failed documents and the FlowFile(s) associated with the failed document(s) will be sent to the "errors" relationship.

property.name: put-es-json-not_found-is-error
property.description: If true, "not_found" Elasticsearch Document associated FlowFiles will be routed to the "success" relationship, otherwise to the "errors" relationship.

dynamicProperty.name: The name of a URL query parameter to add
dynamicProperty.value: The value of the URL query parameter
dynamicProperty.description: Adds the specified property name/value as a query parameter in the Elasticsearch URL used for processing. These parameters will override any matching parameters in the _bulk request body. If FlowFiles are batched, only the first FlowFile in the batch is used to evaluate property values.

relationship.name: retry
relationship.description: All flowfiles that fail due to server/cluster availability go to this relationship.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All flowfiles that succeed in being transferred into Elasticsearch go here. Documents received by the Elasticsearch _bulk API may still result in errors on the Elasticsearch side. The Elasticsearch response will need to be examined to determine whether any Document(s)/Record(s) resulted in errors.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: All flowfiles that fail for reasons unrelated to server availability go to this relationship.

relationship.name: errors
relationship.description: If a "Output Error Documents" is set, any FlowFile(s) corresponding to Elasticsearch document(s) that resulted in an "error" (within Elasticsearch) will be routed here.

writesAttribute.name: elasticsearch.put.error
writesAttribute.description: The error message provided by Elasticsearch if there is an error indexing the document.

systemResourceConsideration.description: The Batch of FlowFiles will be stored in memory until the bulk operation is performed.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.elasticsearch.PutElasticsearchRecord
extension.description: A record-aware Elasticsearch put processor that uses the official Elastic REST client libraries.

property.name: put-es-record-index-op
property.description: The type of the operation used to index (create, delete, index, update, upsert)

property.name: el-rest-fetch-index
property.description: The name of the index to use.

property.name: el-rest-type
property.description: The type of this document (used by Elasticsearch for indexing and searching).

property.name: put-es-record-at-timestamp
property.description: The value to use as the @timestamp field (required for Elasticsearch Data Streams)

property.name: el-rest-client-service
property.description: An Elasticsearch client service to use for running queries.

property.name: put-es-record-reader
property.description: The record reader to use for reading incoming records from flowfiles.

property.name: put-es-record-batch-size
property.description: The number of records to send over in a single batch.

property.name: put-es-record-id-path
property.description: A record path expression to retrieve the ID field for use with Elasticsearch. If left blank the ID will be automatically generated by Elasticsearch.

property.name: put-es-record-retain-id-field
property.description: Whether to retain the existing field used as the ID Record Path.

property.name: put-es-record-index-op-path
property.description: A record path expression to retrieve the Index Operation field for use with Elasticsearch. If left blank the Index Operation will be determined using the main Index Operation property.

property.name: put-es-record-index-record-path
property.description: A record path expression to retrieve the index field for use with Elasticsearch. If left blank the index will be determined using the main index property.

property.name: put-es-record-type-record-path
property.description: A record path expression to retrieve the type field for use with Elasticsearch. If left blank the type will be determined using the main type property.

property.name: put-es-record-at-timestamp-path
property.description: A RecordPath pointing to a field in the record(s) that contains the @timestamp for the document. If left blank the @timestamp will be determined using the main @timestamp property

property.name: put-es-record-retain-at-timestamp-field
property.description: Whether to retain the existing field used as the @timestamp Record Path.

property.name: put-es-record-at-timestamp-date-format
property.description: Specifies the format to use when writing Date fields. If not specified, the default format 'yyyy-MM-dd' is used. If specified, the value must match the Java Simple Date Format (for example, MM/dd/yyyy for a two-digit month, followed by a two-digit day, followed by a four-digit year, all separated by '/' characters, as in 01/25/2017).

property.name: put-es-record-at-timestamp-time-format
property.description: Specifies the format to use when writing Time fields. If not specified, the default format 'HH:mm:ss' is used. If specified, the value must match the Java Simple Date Format (for example, HH:mm:ss for a two-digit hour in 24-hour format, followed by a two-digit minute, followed by a two-digit second, all separated by ':' characters, as in 18:04:15).

property.name: put-es-record-at-timestamp-timestamp-format
property.description: Specifies the format to use when writing Timestamp fields. If not specified, the default format 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss' is used. If specified, the value must match the Java Simple Date Format (for example, MM/dd/yyyy HH:mm:ss for a two-digit month, followed by a two-digit day, followed by a four-digit year, all separated by '/' characters; and then followed by a two-digit hour in 24-hour format, followed by a two-digit minute, followed by a two-digit second, all separated by ':' characters, as in 01/25/2017 18:04:15).

property.name: put-es-record-log-error-responses
property.description: If this is enabled, errors will be logged to the NiFi logs at the error log level. Otherwise, they will only be logged if debug logging is enabled on NiFi as a whole. The purpose of this option is to give the user the ability to debug failed operations without having to turn on debug logging.

property.name: put-es-record-error-writer
property.description: If this configuration property is set, the response from Elasticsearch will be examined for failed records and the failed records will be written to a record set with this record writer service and sent to the "errors" relationship. Successful records will be written to a record setwith this record writer service and sent to the "successful_records" relationship.

property.name: put-es-record-not_found-is-error
property.description: If true, "not_found" Elasticsearch Document associated Records will be routed to the "successful_records" relationship, otherwise to the "errors" relationship.

dynamicProperty.name: The name of a URL query parameter to add
dynamicProperty.value: The value of the URL query parameter
dynamicProperty.description: Adds the specified property name/value as a query parameter in the Elasticsearch URL used for processing. These parameters will override any matching parameters in the _bulk request body

relationship.name: retry
relationship.description: All flowfiles that fail due to server/cluster availability go to this relationship.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All flowfiles that succeed in being transferred into Elasticsearch go here. Documents received by the Elasticsearch _bulk API may still result in errors on the Elasticsearch side. The Elasticsearch response will need to be examined to determine whether any Document(s)/Record(s) resulted in errors.

relationship.name: successful_records
relationship.description: If a "Result Record Writer" is set, any Record(s) corresponding to Elasticsearch document(s) that did not result in an "error" (within Elasticsearch) will be routed here.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: All flowfiles that fail for reasons unrelated to server availability go to this relationship.

relationship.name: errors
relationship.description: If a "Result Record Writer" is set, any Record(s) corresponding to Elasticsearch document(s) that resulted in an "error" (within Elasticsearch) will be routed here.

writesAttribute.name: elasticsearch.put.error
writesAttribute.description: The error message provided by Elasticsearch if there is an error indexing the documents.

writesAttribute.name: elasticsearch.put.error.count
writesAttribute.description: The number of records that generated errors in the Elasticsearch _bulk API.

writesAttribute.name: elasticsearch.put.success.count
writesAttribute.description: The number of records that were successfully processed by the Elasticsearch _bulk API.

systemResourceConsideration.description: The Batch of Records will be stored in memory until the bulk operation is performed.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.elasticsearch.SearchElasticsearch
extension.description: A processor that allows the user to repeatedly run a paginated query (with aggregations) written with the Elasticsearch JSON DSL. Search After/Point in Time queries must include a valid "sort" field. The processor will retrieve multiple pages of results until either no more results are available or the Pagination Keep Alive expiration is reached, after which the query will restart with the first page of results being retrieved.

property.name: el-rest-query
property.description: A query in JSON syntax, not Lucene syntax. Ex: {"query":{"match":{"somefield":"somevalue"}}}.

property.name: el-query-attribute
property.description: If set, the executed query will be set on each result flowfile in the specified attribute.

property.name: el-rest-fetch-index
property.description: The name of the index to use.

property.name: el-rest-type
property.description: The type of this document (used by Elasticsearch for indexing and searching).

property.name: el-rest-client-service
property.description: An Elasticsearch client service to use for running queries.

property.name: el-rest-split-up-hits
property.description: Output a flowfile containing all hits or one flowfile for each individual hit or one flowfile containing all hits from all paged responses.

allowableValue.description: Combine results from all query responses (one flowfile per entire paginated result set of hits). Note that aggregations cannot be paged, they are generated across the entire result set and returned as part of the first page. Results are output with one JSON object per line (allowing hits to be combined from multiple pages without loading all results into memory).

property.name: el-rest-split-up-aggregations
property.description: Output a flowfile containing all aggregations or one flowfile for each individual aggregation.

property.name: el-rest-pagination-type
property.description: Pagination method to use. Not all types are available for all Elasticsearch versions, check the Elasticsearch docs to confirm which are applicable and recommended for your service.

allowableValue.description: Use Elasticsearch "search_after" to page sorted results.
Use Elasticsearch (7.10+ with XPack) "point in time" to page sorted results.

property.name: el-rest-pagination-keep-alive
property.description: Pagination "keep_alive" period. Period Elasticsearch will keep the scroll/pit cursor alive in between requests (this is not the time expected for all pages to be returned, but the maximum allowed time for requests between page retrievals).

property.name: el-rest-output-no-hits
property.description: Output a "hits" flowfile even if no hits found for query. If true, an empty "hits" flowfile will be output even if "aggregations" are output.

dynamicProperty.name: The name of a URL query parameter to add
dynamicProperty.value: The value of the URL query parameter
dynamicProperty.description: Adds the specified property name/value as a query parameter in the Elasticsearch URL used for processing. These parameters will override any matching parameters in the query request body

relationship.name: aggregations
relationship.description: Aggregations are routed to this relationship.

relationship.name: hits
relationship.description: Search hits are routed to this relationship.

writesAttribute.name: mime.type
writesAttribute.description: application/json

writesAttribute.name: aggregation.name
writesAttribute.description: The name of the aggregation whose results are in the output flowfile

writesAttribute.name: aggregation.number
writesAttribute.description: The number of the aggregation whose results are in the output flowfile

writesAttribute.name: page.number
writesAttribute.description: The number of the page (request) in which the results were returned that are in the output flowfile

writesAttribute.name: hit.count
writesAttribute.description: The number of hits that are in the output flowfile

writesAttribute.name: elasticsearch.query.error
writesAttribute.description: The error message provided by Elasticsearch if there is an error querying the index.

stateful.description: The pagination state (scrollId, searchAfter, pitId, hitCount, pageCount, pageExpirationTimestamp) is retained in between invocations of this processor until the Scroll/PiT has expired (when the current time is later than the last query execution plus the Pagination Keep Alive interval).

systemResourceConsideration.description: Care should be taken on the size of each page because each response from Elasticsearch will be loaded into memory all at once and converted into the resulting flowfiles.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.elasticsearch.UpdateByQueryElasticsearch
extension.description: Update documents in an Elasticsearch index using a query. The query can be loaded from a flowfile body or from the Query parameter.

property.name: el-rest-query
property.description: A query in JSON syntax, not Lucene syntax. Ex: {"query":{"match":{"somefield":"somevalue"}}}. If this parameter is not set, the query will be read from the flowfile content.

property.name: el-query-attribute
property.description: If set, the executed query will be set on each result flowfile in the specified attribute.

property.name: el-rest-fetch-index
property.description: The name of the index to use.

property.name: el-rest-type
property.description: The type of this document (used by Elasticsearch for indexing and searching).

property.name: el-rest-client-service
property.description: An Elasticsearch client service to use for running queries.

dynamicProperty.name: The name of a URL query parameter to add
dynamicProperty.value: The value of the URL query parameter
dynamicProperty.description: Adds the specified property name/value as a query parameter in the Elasticsearch URL used for processing. These parameters will override any matching parameters in the query request body

relationship.name: retry
relationship.description: All flowfiles that fail due to server/cluster availability go to this relationship.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: If the "by query" operation succeeds, and a flowfile was read, it will be sent to this relationship.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: If the "by query" operation fails, and a flowfile was read, it will be sent to this relationship.

writesAttribute.name: elasticsearch.update.took
writesAttribute.description: The amount of time that it took to complete the update operation in ms.

writesAttribute.name: elasticsearch.update.error
writesAttribute.description: The error message provided by Elasticsearch if there is an error running the update.
